casebody.data:
Continental Ins. Co. v. Greenwich Ins. Co. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. December 31, 1891.) Exceptions from circuit court, New York county. Action by the Continental Insurance Company against the Greenwich Insurance Company on a policy of reinsurance. Plaintiff’s exceptions were ordered to be heard in the first instance at general term. Overruled.

Argued before Van Brunt, P. J., and Daniels and Barrett, JJ.

Root & Clarke, (Blihu Root and Samuel B. Clarke, of counsel,) for appellant. Wing, Shoudy & Putnam, (J. A. Shoudy, of counsel,) for respondent. Barrett,' J.

Eor the reasons given in the opinion handed down herewith in the case of the same plaintiff against the Ætna Insurance Company of Hartford, Conn., (17 N. Y. Supp. 106,) the exceptions should be overruled, with costs, and judgment entered accordingly. All concur.
